actions.title: Executive Order on Securing the Southern Border and Resumption of Border Wall Construction
actions.description: Directs the Department of Homeland Security to resume construction of the southern border wall, deploy additional Border Patrol agents, and reinstate the Remain in Mexico policy for asylum seekers. Declares a national emergency at the southern border to unlock military construction funding.

actions.title: Executive Order Ending Birthright Citizenship for Children of Undocumented Immigrants
actions.description: Attempts to reinterpret the 14th Amendment to deny automatic citizenship to children born in the United States to parents who are neither citizens nor lawful permanent residents. Directs federal agencies to cease issuing citizenship documents in such cases.

actions.title: Presidential Memorandum on Interior Immigration Enforcement and Deportation Operations
actions.description: Directs ICE to expand interior enforcement operations, eliminate enforcement priorities that shielded certain classes of undocumented immigrants, and increases coordination with state and local law enforcement under 287(g) agreements.

actions.title: Proclamation Suspending Entry of Nationals from Designated Countries
actions.description: Suspends entry into the United States of nationals from an expanded list of countries deemed to present elevated security risks. Expands the geographic scope beyond prior travel restriction orders to include additional African and Central Asian nations.

actions.title: Executive Order on Unleashing American Energy and Withdrawal from the Paris Climate Agreement
actions.description: Withdraws the United States from the Paris Climate Agreement, reverses the moratorium on new federal oil and gas leasing, rescinds the prior administration's climate-related executive orders, and directs agencies to eliminate regulations that impede domestic energy production.

actions.title: Agency Rule Reversing EPA Vehicle Emissions Standards
actions.description: EPA finalizes a rule rolling back tailpipe emission standards for light-duty and medium-duty vehicles set under the prior administration. The revised rule significantly weakens targets for fleet-wide emissions reductions through 2032.

actions.title: Executive Order Eliminating Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Programs in the Federal Government
actions.description: Orders the termination of all DEI offices, programs, and initiatives across federal agencies. Prohibits federal contractors from maintaining DEI requirements and rescinds prior executive orders mandating affirmative action in federal contracting.

actions.title: Policy Directive on Federal Recognition of Two Biological Sexes
actions.description: Directs all federal agencies to define sex as exclusively male or female based on biology at birth for the purposes of federal law, regulations, and policy. Revokes prior guidance permitting gender identity-based accommodations in federal facilities and programs.
agencies: Department of Health and Human Services

actions.title: Executive Order Establishing the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
actions.description: Creates the Department of Government Efficiency as a temporary advisory body within the Executive Office of the President, tasked with identifying waste, fraud, and inefficiency in federal spending. Grants DOGE access to agency financial systems and personnel records to conduct reviews.

actions.title: Presidential Memorandum on Federal Workforce Reduction and Hiring Freeze
actions.description: Institutes a government-wide hiring freeze for civilian federal employees with limited exceptions for military and national security positions. Directs agencies to develop plans for reducing their workforce by 20% through attrition, voluntary separation incentives, and reductions in force.

actions.title: Executive Order Reclassifying Federal Employees Under Schedule F
actions.description: Reinstates and expands Schedule F, reclassifying tens of thousands of career federal employees in policy-influencing positions as at-will employees who can be terminated without standard civil service protections.

actions.title: Executive Order Imposing Universal Baseline Tariffs on All Imports
actions.description: Imposes a baseline 10% tariff on all goods imported into the United States under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, with additional reciprocal tariffs of up to 60% on goods from China and 25% on goods from Canada and Mexico.

actions.title: Agency Rule on Cryptocurrency and Digital Asset Regulatory Framework
actions.description: Establishes a new regulatory framework for digital assets classifying most cryptocurrencies as commodities rather than securities, transferring primary oversight from the SEC to the CFTC. Creates a favorable regulatory environment for domestic crypto exchanges and stablecoin issuers.

actions.title: Signing Statement on Judicial Appointments and Court Expansion Prevention Act
actions.description: Signing statement accompanying legislation that reformed judicial nomination procedures. The statement asserts broad executive authority over the pace of judicial confirmations and challenges provisions requiring Senate consultation timelines as advisory rather than mandatory.

actions.title: Executive Order on Healthcare Price Transparency and ACA Market Reforms
actions.description: Expands healthcare price transparency requirements and directs HHS to approve state innovation waivers allowing alternatives to ACA marketplace plans. Permits the sale of short-term limited-duration insurance plans with coverage periods up to 36 months.
agencies: Department of Health and Human Services
Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

actions.title: Agency Rule Restricting Mifepristone Distribution via Telemedicine
actions.description: FDA finalizes rule reimposing the in-person dispensing requirement for mifepristone, prohibiting distribution by mail-order pharmacies and through telemedicine prescriptions. Adds new REMS (Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy) requirements for prescribers.
agencies: Department of Health and Human Services

actions.title: Policy Directive Prohibiting Federal Funding for Schools with Gender-Identity Policies
actions.description: Directs the Department of Education to withhold federal funding from school districts that maintain policies allowing transgender students to use facilities or participate in sports teams inconsistent with their biological sex at birth.

actions.title: Executive Order on Withdrawal from the World Health Organization
actions.description: Initiates the formal process of withdrawing the United States from the World Health Organization, citing concerns over the organization's handling of international health emergencies and alleged undue influence by China. Redirects WHO funding to bilateral health aid programs.
agencies: Department of Health and Human Services

actions.title: Presidential Memorandum on Restructuring Foreign Aid and USAID Operations
actions.description: Orders a 90-day freeze on all foreign aid disbursements pending a comprehensive review. Directs the consolidation of USAID functions into the State Department and the elimination of programs deemed inconsistent with the America First foreign policy doctrine.

actions.title: Executive Order on Preventing Federal Agencies from Censoring Lawful Speech Online
actions.description: Prohibits federal agencies from communicating with social media companies to request or encourage the removal or suppression of lawful speech. Establishes a White House review board to investigate prior instances of government-directed content moderation and authorizes investigations into platforms alleged to have colluded with government censorship efforts.

pushback.title: ACLU v. Department of Homeland Security - Border Wall Emergency Declaration Challenge
pushback.description: The ACLU challenges the emergency declaration used to redirect military construction funds for border wall construction, arguing it exceeds executive authority and violates the Appropriations Clause of the Constitution.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
pushback.outcome: District court issued preliminary injunction blocking fund diversion; administration appealed to D.C. Circuit.

pushback.title: State of California v. DHS - Remain in Mexico Policy Reinstatement
pushback.description: California and a coalition of states challenge the reinstatement of the Remain in Mexico policy, arguing it violates the Administrative Procedure Act and international asylum obligations.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California

pushback.title: State of New Jersey v. United States - Birthright Citizenship Executive Order Challenge
pushback.description: A coalition of 22 states files suit challenging the birthright citizenship executive order as a direct violation of the 14th Amendment's Citizenship Clause, arguing the executive cannot unilaterally reinterpret a constitutional provision.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Western District of Washington
pushback.outcome: Federal judge granted nationwide temporary restraining order, later converted to preliminary injunction, finding the order plainly unconstitutional.

pushback.title: CASA de Maryland v. Trump - Birthright Citizenship Constitutional Challenge
pushback.description: Immigrant advocacy organizations challenge the birthright citizenship order on behalf of expectant mothers and families, arguing the order violates the 14th Amendment and the equal protection clause.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Maryland
pushback.outcome: Court granted preliminary injunction blocking enforcement of the order.

pushback.title: City of Chicago v. ICE - Sanctuary City Enforcement Operations Challenge
pushback.description: Chicago and other sanctuary cities sue to block expanded ICE enforcement operations in sensitive locations, arguing the operations violate Fourth Amendment protections and longstanding enforcement guidelines.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois

pushback.title: Muslim Advocates v. Trump - Expanded Travel Restriction Challenge
pushback.description: Civil rights organizations challenge the expanded travel ban as exceeding statutory authority under the Immigration and Nationality Act and as discriminatory toward Muslim-majority countries in violation of the Establishment Clause.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia
plaintiffs: National Immigration Project of the National Lawyers Guild

pushback.title: State of New York v. EPA - Paris Agreement Withdrawal and Emissions Rollback
pushback.description: A coalition of states challenges the rescission of climate regulations, arguing that the EPA has a statutory obligation under the Clean Air Act to regulate greenhouse gas emissions regardless of the Paris Agreement withdrawal.
pushback.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit

pushback.title: Earthjustice v. Department of the Interior - Federal Lands Leasing Challenge
pushback.description: Environmental organizations challenge the resumption of federal oil and gas leasing on public lands, arguing the leasing decisions were made without the environmental review required by the National Environmental Policy Act.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Montana

pushback.title: California Air Resources Board v. EPA - Vehicle Emissions Standards Challenge
pushback.description: California and states that follow its emissions standards challenge the rollback of vehicle emissions rules, arguing the EPA failed to provide adequate scientific justification and violated the Clean Air Act's waiver provisions.
pushback.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit
pushback.outcome: D.C. Circuit granted administrative stay pending full review, effectively blocking the rule.

pushback.title: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People v. OPM - DEI Elimination Challenge
pushback.description: The NAACP and other civil rights organizations challenge the elimination of DEI programs, arguing the executive order violates the First Amendment rights of federal employees and exceeds executive authority by preempting congressionally mandated equal opportunity programs.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
plaintiffs: Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights

pushback.title: Federal Employee Unions Coalition v. United States - DEI and Workforce Rights Challenge
pushback.description: A coalition of federal employee unions challenges the DEI order and associated personnel actions, arguing they violate Title VII of the Civil Rights Act and the due process rights of employees whose positions were eliminated.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia

pushback.title: Lambda Legal v. HHS - Biological Sex Policy Directive Challenge
pushback.description: LGBTQ rights organizations challenge the sex-definition policy directive, arguing it violates the Supreme Court's Bostock v. Clayton County ruling that Title VII protects against discrimination based on gender identity and sexual orientation.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Maryland
pushback.outcome: Court issued preliminary injunction blocking enforcement as applied to federal employment and healthcare programs.

pushback.title: State of Washington v. Department of Education - Sex Definition in Schools Challenge
pushback.description: Washington and other states challenge the application of the sex-definition directive to schools receiving federal funds, arguing it conflicts with Title IX and established judicial precedent protecting transgender students.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Western District of Washington
pushback.outcome: Court ruled the directive as applied to educational settings is unlawful; administration appealing to the Ninth Circuit.

pushback.title: National Treasury Employees Union v. Executive Office of the President - DOGE Access to Federal Systems
pushback.description: Federal employee unions challenge DOGE's access to sensitive agency personnel and financial systems, arguing that DOGE personnel lack security clearances and that the access violates the Privacy Act and the Federal Information Security Management Act.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
pushback.outcome: Court issued temporary restraining order limiting DOGE access to systems containing personally identifiable information.

pushback.title: Senate Democratic Caucus Resolution Challenging DOGE Constitutional Authority
pushback.description: Senate Democrats introduce a resolution declaring that DOGE's operations exceed the scope of executive authority by effectively exercising legislative power of the purse. The resolution calls for GAO investigation into DOGE's activities and their compliance with the Antideficiency Act.
plaintiffs: Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs (Minority)

pushback.title: American Federation of Government Employees v. OPM - Federal Hiring Freeze Challenge
pushback.description: Federal employee unions challenge the government-wide hiring freeze and workforce reduction plans, arguing they violate civil service protections and that workforce reduction targets are arbitrary and capricious under the APA.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
pushback.outcome: Court dismissed the case, ruling that the President has broad authority over federal workforce management and the hiring freeze falls within executive discretion.

pushback.title: National Treasury Employees Union v. United States - Schedule F Reclassification Challenge
pushback.description: Federal employee unions and good-government organizations challenge Schedule F, arguing it violates the Civil Service Reform Act and the merit system principles by converting career civil servants to at-will employees subject to political termination.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia

pushback.title: State Attorneys General Coalition v. OPM - Schedule F Federalism Challenge
pushback.description: A coalition of state attorneys general files suit arguing that Schedule F reclassifications of employees in grant-making and regulatory positions will disrupt cooperative federalism programs and violate the Spending Clause.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California

pushback.title: National Foreign Trade Council v. United States - Universal Tariff Authority Challenge
pushback.description: Industry groups challenge the use of IEEPA to impose universal tariffs, arguing the statute was not intended to authorize broad-based trade measures and that the tariffs effectively constitute a tax increase requiring congressional authorization.
pushback.court: U.S. Court of International Trade
pushback.outcome: Court of International Trade upheld the tariffs; case appealed to the Federal Circuit.

pushback.title: Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association v. SEC - Crypto Regulatory Framework Challenge
pushback.description: Securities industry groups challenge the transfer of crypto oversight from SEC to CFTC, arguing the reclassification of digital assets as commodities was done without proper APA notice-and-comment rulemaking and conflicts with existing securities law precedent.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York
plaintiffs: Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association

pushback.title: Senate Judiciary Committee Challenge to Judicial Appointments Signing Statement
pushback.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee minority issues a formal challenge to the signing statement, arguing the President cannot unilaterally declare Senate consultation requirements to be advisory. Introduces legislation to codify mandatory consultation timelines.

pushback.title: American Medical Association v. HHS - Short-Term Insurance Plan Expansion Challenge
pushback.description: Healthcare provider organizations challenge the expansion of short-term limited-duration insurance plans, arguing they undermine ACA risk pools, lack essential health benefit requirements, and that HHS exceeded its authority in approving overly broad state waivers.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
plaintiffs: American Cancer Society Cancer Action Network

pushback.title: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists v. FDA - Mifepristone Access Challenge
pushback.description: Medical professional organizations challenge the reimposition of in-person dispensing requirements for mifepristone, arguing the FDA ignored its own scientific findings on the drug's safety and acted arbitrarily in reversing its prior determination.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Washington
plaintiffs: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists

pushback.title: State of Oregon v. FDA - Mifepristone Telemedicine Restriction
pushback.description: A coalition of states challenges the mifepristone rule, arguing it is preempted by state pharmacy laws and that the FDA failed to provide adequate justification for reversing the telemedicine dispensing authorization in violation of the APA.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Oregon

pushback.title: GLSEN v. Department of Education - Federal Funding Withholding Challenge
pushback.description: Education advocacy organizations and affected school districts challenge the withholding of federal funds, arguing the Department of Education lacks statutory authority to impose conditions on funding not established by Congress and that the directive violates the Spending Clause.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
pushback.outcome: Court granted preliminary injunction blocking the funding withholding, finding the Department exceeded its statutory authority.

pushback.title: Global Health Advocates v. Department of State - WHO Withdrawal Challenge
pushback.description: Public health organizations challenge the WHO withdrawal, arguing that the withdrawal requires congressional authorization because it effectively abrogates a treaty ratified by the Senate. Seeks to block the redirection of WHO funding.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
pushback.outcome: Court dismissed the case for lack of standing, finding the plaintiff organizations did not demonstrate concrete and particularized injury.

pushback.title: Center for Democracy and Technology v. White House - Speech Review Board Challenge
pushback.description: Digital rights organizations challenge the establishment of the White House review board investigating content moderation partnerships, arguing it constitutes government retaliation against protected speech and creates a chilling effect on private platforms' editorial discretion.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California

pushback.title: Meta Platforms and Alphabet v. FTC - Platform Investigation Challenge
pushback.description: Major technology companies challenge the FTC's authority to investigate prior content moderation decisions, arguing the investigations exceed the FTC's statutory mandate and violate the companies' First Amendment editorial rights.
pushback.court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California
